oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Microbial analytical studies of traditional organic preparations beejamrutha and jeevamrutha
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Devakumar, N.
Shubha, S.
Gowder, S.B.
Rao, G.G.E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Biodiversity and ecosystem services
Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic liquid preparations contain higher of bacteria, fungi, actenomycets, N-fixers and P-solubilizers. Form the studies it is evident that beejamrutha is used on the day of preparation and jeevamrutha to be used between 9 to 12 days after preparation. The application of these liquid formulations would supplement the application of biofertilizers and they can be prepared easily by locally available materials by the farmers, in rural area.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Devakumar, N.; Shubha, S.; Gowder, S.B. and Rao, G.G.E. (2014) Microbial analytical studies of traditional organic preparations beejamrutha and jeevamrutha. In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 2, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 639-642.
